title: Using wgpu 0.15.1 crate causes compiler error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust [package] name = "nfractal" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" # See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html [dependencies] wgpu = "0.15.1" ``` I've tested it on blank project with only wgpu 0.15.1. It works fine on wgpu 0.16.0 though. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.71.0-nightly (2f2c438dc 2023-05-08) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2f2c438dce75d8cc532c3baa849eeddc0901802c commit-date: 2023-05-08 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.71.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ```
Error output

``` ~/CLionProjects/nfractal 2darray* ❯ cargo build Compiling wgpu v0.15.1 error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_monomorphize/src/collector.rs:1038:9: no MIR available for DefId(28:2987 ~ wgpu_core[866d]::track::texture::{impl#0}::any_exclusive) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/2f2c438dce75d8cc532c3baa849eeddc0901802c/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1650:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f27b6b6a361 -
